content.description: This is the first route in The Slant that you come across when trending down from the parking lot. Stand start on perfect crimps. Find some thin feet, high step, then follow perfect crimps to the lip. Fun short climb.
content.location: Immediately above First of the Worst. See "The Slant" area description for directions.

content.description:
Kelci tried for the FA, but wasn't quite there yet.

 The very obvious middle crack line on the Slant wall. Low crux climbing leads to some thoughtful, but easier moves up high. Don't waver too much from the obvious line, as the rock quality is suspect to the sides up high.
content.protection: 1 or 2 pads and a decent spotter to keep you from rolling downhill.
content.location: Obvious crack in the middle of The Slant. To the right of the spooky looking death flake.

content.description: A balancy start on thin crimps quickly gives way to monster jugs and an easy topout. Crux is at the bottom.
content.protection: 1 or 2 pads and a decent spotter to keep you from rolling downhill.
content.location: The leftmost route on the slant. about as uphill as it gets before the rock disappears. Just below a ledge with a large dead tree and the climb "Waves"

content.description: Sit start on side pulls with decent feet. Find more jugs as you stand up and work through them to the easier top out.
content.protection: A few pads stacked with a spotter downhill.
content.location: Just to the left of the huge "death flake", and immediately downhill and right of "First of the worst"

content.description: Several problems to be established with a few already cleaned up. Downhill on the East face of the main peak from the bathrooms. A semi obvious downhill trending wall that faces south.
